In the name of God, the merciful and compassionate.
To Qāsim ibn Muḥammad from Nuʿaym ibn Šajara, peace be upon you. I
praise for your sake God, other than whom there is no other god.
As to what follows, we are well and in good health, which will please you,
our Lord be praised. We ask God the completion of his favour upon us and
... und Erfolg upon you and an increase in his munificence and bounty and also sustenance by Him and through Him and success.
in dem, was Er wünscht und womit Er zufrieden ist. We are well and content.
We ask God to grant (us) enjoyment through you and not (suffering) through wrongdoers. For we are always well
so long as God preserves you for us.
I am writing to you as you wished. Good health [ ] ...and whatever Teile uns Nachricht über Dich und daß Du gesund und wohlbehalten bist, mit.
requirements you have of us [ ] God
Peace be upon you and mercy.
[From Qāsim ib]n Muḥammad to [Nuʿaym ibn Šaǧara and ʿAb]dallāh ibn Muslim.
